doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 2 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 178[Air Date: 1/7/1986]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 2 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 178[Air Date: 1/7/1986]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. Two-month-long San Francisco vigil2. New York poll on gay acceptance3. The Fund for Human Dignity receives first contribution from a major United States CorporationCOMMERCIAL: NGTF Fund for Human Dignity4. Six New Mexico lesbians take on Albuquerque Police Department for unlawful arrest and sexual harassment charges5. Philadelphia Bill threatens HTLVIII test result privacy6. Federal Centers for Disease Control have put safe sex programs on hold out of concern for explicitness7. District of Columbia City Council passes legislation, protects privacy of persons with HIV and AIDS8. Members of San Francisco Lesbian gay Freedom Day parade Committee votes to retain word "lesbian" in the name of parade9. AIDS positive Michael Callen, member of People with AIDS, discusses the group and his survival for the past four yearsCOMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp10. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Audrey Hassell, Coordinator of Financial Advocacy, discusses her position11. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. Sybil BruncheonCOMMERCIAL: The Monster2. Sybil Bruncheon reads mailCOMMERCIAL: The Grande Gala-Gay, The Islanders' Club3. Current events/media/culture, includes clipsCOMMERCIAL: AIDS hotline, New York AIDS Action4. Cabaret Beat with Bradshaw Smith, includes clips
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 2 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 178 [Air Date: 1/7/1986]: January 1986
